channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: New Poll Shows Trump’s Support Slipping, and Clintons Face Contempt Vote in Epstein Inquiry
item.description: Plus, how A.I. is judging your résumé.

item.title: Donald Trump, Live From Davos
item.description: It’s striking how clearheadedly and defiantly Europeans are reacting to the president’s provocations.

item.title: Winter Storm Forecast: What to Expect as Snow and Ice Move Across the U.S. This Weekend
item.description: Half the U.S. population will likely see some effect from the sprawling storm that will move across the country this weekend, meteorologists said.

item.title: Ken Griffin says America was sent an ‘explicit warning’ from the bond market and it’s time to get the national debt in order
item.description: "I think there's an explicit warning that if your fiscal house is not in order, the bond vigilantes can come out and retract their price," Ken Griffin...

item.title: The Trump TACO trade is driving up the price of gold as central banks hoard bullion to hedge against the dollar
item.description: Gold has overtaken the euro and U.S. Treasuries as the preferred source of reserves for central banks, the team at LPL Financial reported.

item.title: Exclusive: Cubby raises $63 million in Goldman Sachs-led funding to scale self-storage software
item.description: Cubby just raised a $63 million Series A, led by Growth Equity at Goldman Sachs Alternatives, Fortune has exclusively learned.

item.title: Jack Smith to Testify Before Congress on Trump Investigations
item.description: The appearance provides Mr. Smith with what is likely to be his best opportunity to challenge President Trump’s assertion that he was persecuted for h...

item.title: Elon Musk predicts ‘agonizingly slow’ Cybercab and Optimus rollout. But he’s not giving up on Tesla’s big bet on robots
item.description: Tesla’s production rate will “eventually end up being insanely fast,” Musk said.

item.title: Trump Takes Davos
item.description: We look at the news coming out of the World Economic Forum in Switzerland.

item.title: Ray Dalio says CEOs mourning the rules-based order must accept that change is here for good
item.description: Also: All the news and watercooler chat from Fortune.

item.title: Newsom Blames Trump for Cancellation of His Davos Appearance
item.description: Gov. Gavin Newsom of California said the Trump administration had denied him entry to an American venue at the World Economic Forum. It’s not clear if...

item.title: Iran’s Protests Have Been Completely Squashed, Government Says
item.description: After a crackdown that killed thousands, Iran’s prosecutor general said on Wednesday that “the sedition is over now,” vowing to punish those responsib...

item.title: Three Dead After Shooting in Rural Australian Town
item.description: The shooting happened on a day when Australians were honoring the victims of the Bondi Beach massacre, and just after gun laws were tightened.

item.title: Tânia Maria Is Brazil’s Newest Film Icon
item.description: Clad in florals and puffing on a cigarette, Tânia Maria has captivated audiences with a striking, if brief, performance in “The Secret Agent,” Brazil’...

item.title: Live Updates: Trump Officials Tout Gaza Plan at ‘Board of Peace’ Ceremony in Davos
